sentences.en: ...a newly restored monument commemorating a 119-year-old tragedy.
sentences.cn: …为纪念一起有着119年历史的惨剧而新修复的一座纪念碑。

sentences.en: A monument to him was erected in St Paul's Cathedral.
sentences.cn: 在圣保罗大教堂为他修了一座纪念碑。

sentences.en: A monument was erected to the memory of that great scientist.
sentences.cn: 树立了一块纪念碑纪念那位伟大的科学家.

sentences.en: A wreath was laid on the monument to a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.cn: 在响亮的号角声中花圈被献在纪念碑前.

sentences.en: Ancient monuments are protected by law.
As Wren's epitaph famously declares, the cathedral itself is his monument.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，雷恩的墓志铭中写道，大教堂本身就是他的纪念碑。

sentences.en: By his international achievements he leaves a fitting monument to his beliefs.
sentences.cn: 他在国际上的成就为其信念作出了最好的注解。

sentences.en: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.cn: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

sentences.en: The monument bears the mark of age.
sentences.cn: 纪念碑上有年深日久的痕迹.

sentences.en: The monument predates the arrival of the druids in Britain.
sentences.cn: 这一遗迹在德鲁伊特来到不列颠前就已存在。

sentences.en: The monument towers aloft on the square.
The monument was erected after the war.
sentences.cn: 这座纪念碑是战后建立起来的.

sentences.en: The monument was erected in his honour.
sentences.cn: 这座碑是为纪念他而建的.

sentences.en: The monument was unveiled with great solemnity.
sentences.cn: 纪念碑的揭幕庄严而肃穆.

sentences.en: The whole house is a monument to her craftsmanship.
sentences.cn: 那整座房子是她技艺的一座丰碑。

sentences.en: There is a massive monument in the square.
sentences.cn: 广场上有一座巨大的纪念碑.

sentences.en: They set up a bronze statue [ monument ] to his memory.
sentences.cn: 他们立了一座铜像 [ 纪念碑 ] 纪念他.
这座碑是纪念我们胜利的.

words.tran_cn: 不朽的；纪念碑的；非常的

phrases.tran_cn: 国立纪念物，国家历史文物

trans.tran_en: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person
